name: epicurus
text:
I'll notice how I feel as the cup gets heavier.

Teodor's expression is great.

name: geozimmdrake
text: i really like ray's faces in the second to last and third to last panels. its like "no wait, dont do it man, dont do it!"  and then ":o("

name: carlyle
text: I think he's reaching helplessly towards the water that will give him weight and then accepting the fact that good things should be in moderation.

name: spicyponyhead
text: [IMGS OFF]

text: p.s. this isn't me. Found on Flickr.

name: hollis
text: Sciencize it!

name: straw
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: ocarina654
text: Why this doesn't have more chubbies is beyond me.

name: straw
text: You will see that it is, at time of this writing, only four days old.  If people are so kind as to give that a chubby, it will most likely be gradually done.

name: stuart
text: A guy on the SA forums has a much more fluid gif of this as his avatar.

name: sweetlips
text: Man, did you really pay for an internet forum?

name: lennysa
text: He possibly didn't.  It was free when I joined.

name: atticusonline
text: A comment left by atticusonline was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, riotdejaneiro, Mangtastic, kenthegod, Howard, differentdog)

name: jollysaintpete
text: A comment left by jollysaintpete was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by riotdejaneiro, atticusonline, Lumus, Appers)

name: atticusonline
text:
Why would I make a better one? The comic that Chris made is perfectly fine the way it is.

But no, it's cool...lame me to make yourself feel special :-)

name: greenkoolayd
text: you lamed yourself by being a douchequeef.

name: atticusonline
text: You mean I got chubbied 3 times and then lamed by a douchequeef.

name: greenkoolayd
text: im probably just jealous of how intelligent you think you are.

name: redion
text: just gave you chubby number 150. you are welcome.

name: everything_is_a_hat
text: this is the first Achewood strip I ever saw.

name: j-man
text: It was one of the first strips I've seen. To be honest, I was Teodor in the last panel after reading it.

name: hipjiverobot
text: I think if I could choose the first strip i saw, this would probably be it.

name: jesler729
text: Seriously. It is such a perfect introduction.

name: saint
text: A comment left by saint was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by fosters, RBisme, Darthemed, kochipoik)

name: epicurus
text: The sad part is that someday this will be the thesis statement of a six-part philosophical treatise called 'Saint's Meditations on Humour"

name: davidadam
text: The way the last six panels plays out is brilliant. No need for words.

name: rogergs
text: It does take all five dialogueless panels to transition the reader from a mental state that understands what is going on, to Teodor's state.

name: djwhiterabbit
text: as funny as it is like this, i would still love to hear the dialogue between beef and ray after the third ounce is poured.

name: dunkus-bolunkus
text: There is no dialogue worth reporting, simply grunts, whoops and groans. A man should not have to hear that from another man.

name: kazad
text: Well, I bet panel 9 is just Ray yelling "RAAAAAAAAD!!"

name: madnes
text: Panel 8 is clearly "Yeah man! We doin' this!"

name: vondicus
text: Panel 8 alone is a fairly accurate representation of Achewood in general.

name: darkwaffle
text: If I were Teodor, I don't even know what I would think.

name: chaesar
text: You look at a window long enough, you're gonna see some things.

name: epicurus
text: This needs to be said by a hard-boiled detective, maybe play when my computer starts up?

name: tonyhighwind
text: I like to think that long after we're dead, this will be remembered.  That statement is about as true as a statement can be.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Why is Teodor looking in the window?

name: daklin
text: ALT TEXT: This could be therapeutic...something you wear around the house, during winter or after a bad day at the office, to prevent SO-SAD.

name: patkun
text: do measuring jugs usually measure in ounces?

name: relaxing
text: Yes.

name: zem
text: 'fluid ounces' are a  unit of volume and here in **america** it is how we measure our liquids

name: dovey
text:
IN AMERICA FREEDOM IS MEASURED IN FLUID OUNCES

OF FREEDOM

name: antsama
text: Ray shows signs of addiction no later than 4 ounces in.  This is a new and terrifying drug that is sweeping the youth and felines.  Mostly felines.

name: fosters
text: Batman seems really concerned about this.

name: zeroasalimit
text: Anyone tried this?

name: rexsjain
text: I repeat, has anyone tried this?

name: keithcozz
text: A comment left by keithcozz was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by facehead, oishii, equinn2006, illgamesh, Epicurus, STUART)

name: keithcozz
text: Sorry about that...Damn, am I grumpy!

name: madrin
text: dude, it's cool. you are merely crying out for your long-lost dong.

name: epicurus
text: But, but... that's the only thing I have to contribute!

name: fosters
text: Come on dude, that's not the ONLY thing you contribute. You also bring "I say this all the time in real life" to the table, here.

name: epicurus
text: Can we just let that one die? Those were simpler times.

name: fosters
text: Sorry, I'm going through these things right now and not paying a ton of attention to the time stamps. If the observation is no longer accurate then consider it cheerfully rescinded.

name: epicurus
text:
Nowadays I mostly imply that I had sex with someone and still say that I say the strip all the time but now I phrase it differently so that it doesn't get lamed out as quickly.

I mean, yeah bro, awesome.

name: _cheesekayke
text: I don't get panels 11 and 12. Why does Roast Beef get all pissed and take Ray's cup away from him?

name: pitseleh
text: Ray was being RUUUUDE!

name: godfatherofsouls
text: yeah, too much weight'll work on you like a roid rage

name: plezure
text: A comment left by plezure was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Dovey, speedwell, STUART)

name: talix18
text: I do.  The comments often add so much to the strips that it would be a shame to pass them over.

name: luckyg
text: A comment left by luckyg was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by jargonmaster, fmercury, speedwell, holly_golightly)

name: saru
text:
Go to Gunnerkrig Court. Read some of the comments on any given strip.
Gouge out your eyes and come running to the bastion of worldly intellectualism that is Acheworld.
It's a moronic wankfest as opposed to the fascinating and valuable wankfest here, and I've seen the same thing on other comics that enable comments.
Gunnerkrig Court is a superb bit of work, so it isn't just the quality of the comic reflecting in the comments.
I'd guess it's the intellectual flair of Achewood (I feel kind of silly but kind of awesome saying this when the specific strip I'm commenting under portrays a cat having water poured into a cup on a cantilever attached to his groin, while an alive stuffed bear watches in bewilderment.

name: heccibiggs
text: Me. I've just discovered Achewood and have read through the whole archive (well, I'm up to here now), and I tend to read most of the comments. In fact, the main reason I signed up was because the curiosity of what was containted in all the comments that had been lamed out of existence was becoming too great.

name: kochipoik
text: It's true, I'm only yet up to here, and reading the comments often adds quite a lot to the strip - and often explains alot, too.

name: tourach3
text: looks like you women are a few weeks ahead of me... could be because i take my time for the most part

name: charchar
text: A friend recommended Achewood to me (I know, passive voice), and I accidentally clicked 'discuss' three strips in.  I signed up because somebody said something to which I wanted to reply.  So, as I go through the archives, it is also my first time seeing the strips.  I am a n00b of the worst sort.

name: kelsotimebomb
text:
I've been reading Achewood for a really long time, but this is my first sequential re-tread through the archives since the whole assetbar thing happened.\

And yeah, the comments sometimes totally make it.

name: i_love_kate
text: That clause wasn't in the passive voice at all.

name: heccibiggs
text:
You're right, the passive voice would be "Achewood was recommened to me by a friend".

Get it together, charchar!

name: heccibiggs
text: Wait - I_Love_Kate, who are you talking to?

name: i_love_kate
text: The person who mentioned the passive voice, by and large. Also Freddy Fractions, but that's none of your concern.

name: alzuna
text:
I signed up to see the lamed comments too and I'm glad I'm reading it in the assetbar there are some things I miss that are revealed in the comments, and I wouldn't be able to read the blogs sequentially at all.

Also to Gunnerkrigg's credit you can't read comments unless they are from THAT day, there is no comments archive, so if you are reading through it for the first time you are spared the idiocy.

name: red-barchetta
text: I don't even bother with the comments on the newer strips as there is almost immediately 500 of them and most of them are completely irrelevant to the strip or achewood itself.

name: alzuna
text: Yea I've noticed that, I'm in the last year of the archives and either because I'm burned out on comments or something I just don't read them as much....

name: pogo
text: I think the energy went out of everyone by then, having raced back through the archives for the first year, catching up to the present day, that took a lot of energy.  Many of the early posters seem to have vanished.  Are you looking at the new strips as they are posted?

name: alzuna
text: Not lately, I stopped reading my bookmarked webcomics for a while so I'm behind again just after I caught up. *sadface*

name: hamscout
text:
Wait, so you've stopped reading the current strips because of the inordinate amount of comments unrelated to the strip, and you are working your way through the archives, making several comments that are unrelated to the strip?

just saying'...

name: hamscout
text:
Full Disclosure:
I am one of the folks known to contribute many non-strip-related comments in the current day, and I am wending my way through the archives once more, to read the old comments and make contributions.
Though in the current strips I often scroll past vast wastelands of posts I have no interest in, there are many many nuggets of pure gold to be mined in nearly every strip's posts. I encourage you to mine them.

name: pogo
text: Very true, and some of us know how to use our INBOX function to actually find fresh responses to past comments.

name: dovey
text: You do!

name: hughnin
text: The look on Ray's face in the 12th panel is sheer gold. It looks like someone took an ice cream cone away from him, or something of that caliber/

name: phy
text: The only thing that can really improve upon Achewood: the scientific method.

name: thecasbah
text: Ray's facial expressions in panels eleven & twelve demonstrate exactly what it feels like to have a completely trashy orgasm taken away from you.

name: kochipoik
text: I was contemplating laming your comment, before I realised thats probably the exact face I would/do make when a completely trashy orgasm is taken away from me.

name: meowmix
text: Teodor's facial expression makes this strip for me.

name: ampkit5
text: The last 6 panals are the perfect strip all by themselves.

name: lawbot
text: Two cats one cup?

name: achilleselbow
text: Apparently at least one other person has seen this and deemed it grossly unnecessary. Besides the utter grossness of what you refer to, historicity demands that we consider this comic in the time that it was written, a better time when such things didn't exist on the planet.

name: swatson
text: Four ounces is optimal.

name: imbattin
text: ...once you get goin', don't stop, or you'll get maaad ...

name: jonmw
text: Is Ray trying to imply that his dick weighs an ounce?

name: kaz
text: an all time favorite

name: buttbutter
text: Pretty much my favorite story arc, along with anything involving mexican magical realism. Put it in right now mister! ray seems to be saying
